page.title: 07 Glen Laragain: Forestry 1
page.content: {The Forest and its History} In the late 1960s Glen Laragain was acquired by the present owners, West Highland Woodlands,from 'Lochiel' -local laird, Lord Lieutenant to Her Majesty, and Chief of the clan Cameron. Previously the hill was marginal grazing for sheep and deer. Glen Laragain as it is today is a large forest which covers 468 hectares and has a boundary fence approximately seven miles long. Within the forest there are nearly one million trees growing, which were planted between 1968 and 1969, mainly Sitka Spruce, but some Lodgepole Pine and Larch too. To give access, and also in the years to come to enable lorries into the plantation to haul the timber out to the sawmill, a network of approximately four miles of roads have been built within the forest.
